original: @49b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @49b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: badzra t'a r'a s'a dha nam /
analyzed: badzra t'a r'a s'a dha nam /
translated: Vajratārāsādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rdo rje sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: rdo rje sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The Means of Attaining Vajra Tārā

original: bcom ldan 'das sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sgrol ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Blessed Tārā.

original: sbyin sreg las kyi cho ga yis //
analyzed: sbyin sreg las kyi cho ga yis //
translated: By the ritual of the fire offering,

original: 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed pa'i //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don kun sgrub byed pa'i //
translated: accomplishing all desired aims,

original: rdo rje sgrol ma sgrub pa'i thabs //
analyzed: rdo rje sgrol ma sgrub pa'i thabs //
translated: is the means of attaining Vajra Tārā.

original: de nas yang dag bshad bya ba //
analyzed: de nas yang dag bshad bya ba //
translated: Now, I will explain it again.

original: de la sngags kyi tshig ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la sngags kyi tshig ni 'di yin te /
translated: The mantra words are as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: na ma a'arya aa ba lo ki te sh'a r'a ya /
analyzed: na ma a'arya aa ba lo ki te sh'a r'a ya /
translated: Namo 'ryāvalokiteśvarāya

original: bo dhi sa tv'a ya /
analyzed: bo dhi sa tv'a ya /
translated: bodhisattvāya

original: ma h'a sa tv'a ya /
analyzed: ma h'a sa tv'a ya /
translated: mahāsattvāya

original: ma h'a k'a ru ni k'a ya /
analyzed: ma h'a k'a ru ni k'a ya /
translated: mahākāruṇikāya

original: tadya th'a / aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re ma ma kri ta sarba dusht'am pra dusht'am dzambha ya /
analyzed: tadya th'a / aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re ma ma kri ta sarba dusht'am pra dusht'am dzambha ya /
translated: Tadyathā: Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture mama kṛta sarva duṣṭaṃ praduṣṭaṃ jaṃbha jaṃbha

original: stambha ya / mo ha ya /
analyzed: stambha ya / mo ha ya /
translated: stambhaya stumbhaya mohaya

original: bandha ya / h'um h'um h'um /
analyzed: bandha ya / h'um h'um h'um /
translated: bandhaya huṃ huṃ huṃ

original: phat phat phat /
analyzed: phat phat phat /
translated: phaṭ phaṭ phaṭ

original: sarba dusht'am stam bha ni t'a re sv'a h'a /
analyzed: sarba dusht'am stam bha ni t'a re sv'a h'a /
translated: sarva duṣṭaṃ stāmbhani tāre svāhā.

original: de la dang po re zhig rang gi snying gar zla ba la sa bon t'am bsam ste /
analyzed: de la dang po re zhig rang gi snying gar zla ba la sa bon t'am bsam ste /
translated: First, one should visualize the seed syllable taṃ on a moon at one’s heart.

original: de'i 'od kyis bla ma dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' spyan drangs te /
analyzed: de'i 'od kyis bla ma dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' spyan drangs te /
translated: Light from that invites the gurus, buddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: mchod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yang dag par mchod la /
translated: One should make offerings with various offerings.

original: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya zhing /
analyzed: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya zhing /
translated: One should confess misdeeds and so forth.

original: gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i tshigs bcad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i tshigs bcad brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the verse for going for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: de nas tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgoms la /
analyzed: de nas tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgoms la /
translated: Then, one should meditate on the four divine abodes.

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a wa a'atma ko& ham zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra oṃ śūnyatā jñāna vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ.

original: de nas pam las skyes pa'i padma dang zla ba'i steng du yang t'am gi sa bon yang bsams te /
analyzed: de nas pam las skyes pa'i padma dang zla ba'i steng du yang t'am gi sa bon yang bsams te /
translated: Then, one should visualize the seed syllable taṃ on a lotus and moon arisen from paṃ.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: From that,

original: ma mo'i dkyil 'khor dbus gnas pa'i //
analyzed: ma mo'i dkyil 'khor dbus gnas pa'i //
translated: in the center of the maṇḍala of the mothers,

original: lha mo sgrol ma bsgom par bya //
analyzed: lha mo sgrol ma bsgom par bya //
translated: one should meditate on the goddess Tārā.

original: zhal bzhi ma la phyag brgyad ma //
analyzed: zhal bzhi ma la phyag brgyad ma //
translated: She has four faces and eight arms.

original: rgyan rnams kyis ni brgyan pa yi ;
analyzed: rgyan rnams kyis ni brgyan pa yi ;
translated: One should meditate on the golden-hued

original: / gser gyi mdog can bsgom par bya //
analyzed: / gser gyi mdog can bsgom par bya //
translated: one who is adorned with ornaments.

original: gzhon nu ma yi mtshan nyid 'bar //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma yi mtshan nyid 'bar //
translated: The characteristics of a young woman blaze,

original: sna tshogs padma'i gdan gnas pa'i //
analyzed: sna tshogs padma'i gdan gnas pa'i //
translated: seated on a variegated lotus seat,

original: zla ba'i gdan la yang dag bzhugs //
analyzed: zla ba'i gdan la yang dag bzhugs //
translated: sitting on a moon seat.

original: ser dang nag dang dkar dang dmar //
analyzed: ser dang nag dang dkar dang dmar //
translated: Yellow, black, white, and red

original: g-yas skor du ni zhal bzhi'o //
analyzed: g-yas skor du ni zhal bzhi'o //
translated: are the four faces, turning to the right.

original: spyan gsum rdo rje skyil krung gnas //
analyzed: spyan gsum rdo rje skyil krung gnas //
translated: Three eyes, seated in vajra posture,

original: 'od dmar sangs rgyas bzhi yi dbu rgyan can //
analyzed: 'od dmar sangs rgyas bzhi yi dbu rgyan can //
translated: red-colored, with a crown of the four buddhas,

original: rdo rje mda' dang dung dang mchog sbyin ni //
analyzed: rdo rje mda' dang dung dang mchog sbyin ni //
translated: holding a vajra arrow, a conch, and a boon-granting gesture

original: g-yas kyi phyag na bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas kyi phyag na bsnams pa'o //
translated: in the right hands,

original: autpal gzhu dang rdo rje lcags kyu zhags //
analyzed: autpal gzhu dang rdo rje lcags kyu zhags //
translated: an utpala, a bow, a vajra hook, and a noose

original: sdigs mdzub g-yon pa'i phyag rnams 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: sdigs mdzub g-yon pa'i phyag rnams 'chang ba'o //
translated: in the left hands, holding a threatening gesture.

original: rdo rje skyil krung rnal 'byor gyis //
analyzed: rdo rje skyil krung rnal 'byor gyis //
translated: By the yoga of the vajra posture,

original: sa gsum po yang bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: sa gsum po yang bsgrub par bya //
translated: one should accomplish the three worlds.

original: de'i mdun me tog sgrol @50a * //
analyzed: de'i mdun me tog sgrol @50a * //
translated: In front of him is Flower Tārā,

original: ma ni ; / mdog ni dkar zhing yid 'ong ma //
analyzed: ma ni ; / mdog ni dkar zhing yid 'ong ma //
translated: white-colored, pleasing,

original: aom yig las ni yang dag rdzogs //
analyzed: aom yig las ni yang dag rdzogs //
translated: perfected from the syllable oṃ.

original: me tog phreng ba phyag na bsnams //
analyzed: me tog phreng ba phyag na bsnams //
translated: And holds a garland of flowers in her hand.

original: zhal gcig phyag ni gnyis pa ste //
analyzed: zhal gcig phyag ni gnyis pa ste //
translated: She has one face and two arms,

original: rgyan rnams kun gyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyan rnams kun gyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: And is adorned with all the ornaments.

original: lho phyogs bdug spos sgrol ma ni //
analyzed: lho phyogs bdug spos sgrol ma ni //
translated: In the south, the incense Tārā

original: gzugs mdzes mdog ni nag po ste //
analyzed: gzugs mdzes mdog ni nag po ste //
translated: Is beautiful, with a dark complexion,

original: bdug spos snod ni phyag bsnams shing //
analyzed: bdug spos snod ni phyag bsnams shing //
translated: Holding an incense vessel in her hand,

original: rgyan rnams kun gyis rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: rgyan rnams kun gyis rnam par brgyan //
translated: And adorned with all the ornaments.

original: nub phyogs mar me sgrol ma yang //
analyzed: nub phyogs mar me sgrol ma yang //
translated: In the west, the lamp Tārā

original: mdog ni ser zhing yid 'phrog ma //
analyzed: mdog ni ser zhing yid 'phrog ma //
translated: Is yellow, captivating,

original: bzang mo mar me snod bsnams shing //
analyzed: bzang mo mar me snod bsnams shing //
translated: The excellent one holding a lamp vessel,

original: gser gyi rna cha rab tu g-yo //
analyzed: gser gyi rna cha rab tu g-yo //
translated: With golden earrings swaying.

original: byang phyogs dri yi sgrol ma ni //
analyzed: byang phyogs dri yi sgrol ma ni //
translated: In the north, the scent Tārā

original: dri yi dung chos phyag na bsnams //
analyzed: dri yi dung chos phyag na bsnams //
translated: Holds a scent conch in her hand,

original: lha mo mdog ni dmar 'dra ba //
analyzed: lha mo mdog ni dmar 'dra ba //
translated: The goddess with a reddish complexion,

original: snying po dkyil 'khor la bsgom bya //
analyzed: snying po dkyil 'khor la bsgom bya //
translated: Meditating in the essence maṇḍala.

original: 'di kun zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa //
analyzed: 'di kun zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa //
translated: All of them have one face and two arms,

original: rgyan rnams kyis ni rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: rgyan rnams kyis ni rnam par brgyan //
translated: Adorned with all the ornaments,

original: rdo rje skyil mo krung gis so //
analyzed: rdo rje skyil mo krung gis so //
translated: In the vajra posture.

original: lha mo drug po 'di kun ni //
analyzed: lha mo drug po 'di kun ni //
translated: All these six goddesses

original: cung zad zhal ni gtsigs pa ste //
analyzed: cung zad zhal ni gtsigs pa ste //
translated: Bare their fangs slightly,

original: 'gying bag bcas pas yang dag gnas //
analyzed: 'gying bag bcas pas yang dag gnas //
translated: And with pride, one should remain in the right way.🔽

original: 'di dag dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo //
analyzed: 'di dag dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo //
translated: And with a proud bearing, one should visualize them in the mandala.

original: bsams la shar sgor bsam pa ni //🔽rdo rje lcags kyu 'od 'bar ma //
analyzed: bsams la shar sgor bsam pa ni // rdo rje lcags kyu 'od 'bar ma //
translated: Visualizing them at the eastern gate,🔽One should visualize the blazing vajra hook,

original: phyag na rdo rje lcags kyus mtshan //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje lcags kyus mtshan //
translated: Marked with a vajra hook,

original: yid 'ong ma yi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: yid 'ong ma yi bdag nyid do //
translated: And endowed with a beautiful form.

original: lho sgor rdo rje zhags pa ma //
analyzed: lho sgor rdo rje zhags pa ma //
translated: At the southern gate, the vajra noose,

original: nag cing shin tu 'dod la dga' //
analyzed: nag cing shin tu 'dod la dga' //
translated: Black and very passionate,

original: bzang po rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i lus //🔽rdo rje zhags pa 'chang ba'i mchog / rdo rje lcags sgrog mdog ser ma //
analyzed: bzang po rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i lus // rdo rje zhags pa 'chang ba'i mchog / rdo rje lcags sgrog mdog ser ma //
translated: With a body adorned with excellent ornaments,🔽Holding the supreme vajra noose.🔽At the western gate, one should visualize the yellow vajra chain,

original: rdo rje lcags sgrog phyag bsnams shing //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags sgrog phyag bsnams shing //
translated: Holding a vajra chain,

original: sna tshogs rgyan gyis brgyan pa ni //🔽nub kyi sgo ru bsam par bya //🔽byang sgor rdo rje dril bu ma //
analyzed: sna tshogs rgyan gyis brgyan pa ni // nub kyi sgo ru bsam par bya // byang sgor rdo rje dril bu ma //
translated: Adorned with various ornaments,🔽With a beautiful form.🔽At the northern gate, the vajra bell,

original: rdo rje dril bu rab bsnams pa'i //
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu rab bsnams pa'i //
translated: Holding a vajra and bell,

original: mdog dmar bzang po yi ni gzugs //
analyzed: mdog dmar bzang po yi ni gzugs //
translated: With a beautiful form, red in color,

original: dge zhing rtag par blta bar bya //
analyzed: dge zhing rtag par blta bar bya //
translated: Virtuous and always to be seen.

original: steng du gtsug tor rnam rgyal ma //
analyzed: steng du gtsug tor rnam rgyal ma //
translated: Above, one should visualize the uṣṇīṣa queen,

original: gzugs bzang mdog ni ser ba ste //
analyzed: gzugs bzang mdog ni ser ba ste //
translated: Beautiful, yellow in color,

original: byang chub 'bras bu sbyin byed bsam //🔽de nas sngags pas 'khor lo 'chang //
analyzed: byang chub 'bras bu sbyin byed bsam // de nas sngags pas 'khor lo 'chang //
translated: And the fruit of enlightenment, the gift.🔽Then the mantrin should hold the wheel

original: snying po dkyil 'khor 'og tu ni //
analyzed: snying po dkyil 'khor 'og tu ni //
translated: Under the mandala of the essence,

original: dge zhing 'od 'bar ba yi gzugs //
analyzed: dge zhing 'od 'bar ba yi gzugs //
translated: The form of virtue, blazing with light,

original: klu yi zhags pa phyag na bsnams //
analyzed: klu yi zhags pa phyag na bsnams //
translated: Holding a noose of snakes in his hand.

original: zhal gcig phyag ni gnyis pa ste //
analyzed: zhal gcig phyag ni gnyis pa ste //
translated: He has one face and two arms,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa yid 'ong ma //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa yid 'ong ma //
translated: The mind of omniscience, pleasing,

original: mdog nag rnam par bsgom par bya //
analyzed: mdog nag rnam par bsgom par bya //
translated: Dark in color, one should visualize.

original: yi ge bcu po 'di yis ni //
analyzed: yi ge bcu po 'di yis ni //
translated: By means of these ten syllables,

original: lha mo bcu ni rnam par sprul //
analyzed: lha mo bcu ni rnam par sprul //
translated: The ten goddesses are emanated.

original: pha rol phyin bcu dag pa ste //
analyzed: pha rol phyin bcu dag pa ste //
translated: The purity of the ten perfections,

original: chos kun rab tu 'grub par byed //
analyzed: chos kun rab tu 'grub par byed //
translated: It accomplishes all dharmas.

original: de la yi ge bcu pa ni //
analyzed: de la yi ge bcu pa ni //
translated: The ten syllables are:

original: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re sv'a h'a /
translated: Om tare tuttare ture svaha.

original: rang gi snying ga'i @50b sa bon gyi 'od kyis ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drangs te /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i @50b sa bon gyi 'od kyis ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drangs te /
translated: By the light of the seed syllable in one's heart center, the wisdom wheel is invoked.

original: dza:h'um bam ho:zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis dgug pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: dza:h'um bam ho:zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis dgug pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: With the mantra Jham hrimm bam hoh, one should perform the summoning and so forth.

original: de bzhin du sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / thig le dang / phra mo dang / bzlas pa la sogs pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa dang / dbang bskur ba dang / thig le dang / phra mo dang / bzlas pa la sogs pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should meditate on the consecration of body, speech, and mind, the conferral of initiation, the subtle bindu, and the repetition of mantra.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyis phyag byas pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyis phyag byas pa //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas!

original: sngags mchog 'di ni gtso bo ste //
analyzed: sngags mchog 'di ni gtso bo ste //
translated: This supreme mantra is the chief

original: bzang po brjod pas grub 'gyur ba //
analyzed: bzang po brjod pas grub 'gyur ba //
translated: of the good recitations,

original: rdo rje gur las gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gur las gsungs pa'o //
translated: as taught in the Vajrapañjara.

original: 'dir sngags 'di nye bar spyod pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir sngags 'di nye bar spyod pa ni /
translated: Here, the practice of this mantra is as follows:

original: sngags 'dis gos kyi thub nas bzung ste lan bdun bsngags la mdud pa byas te /
analyzed: sngags 'dis gos kyi thub nas bzung ste lan bdun bsngags la mdud pa byas te /
translated: Having enchanted one's garment seven times with this mantra, one should tie it.

original: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i sa gang du 'gro ba yang 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i sa gang du 'gro ba yang 'jigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Wherever one goes, even to a fearful place, one will not be afraid.

original: stag dang / rkun ma dang / chu srin dang / seng ge dang / sprul dang / glang po dang / ma he dang / dred dang / rta la sogs pas kyang gnod par mi byed do //
analyzed: stag dang / rkun ma dang / chu srin dang / seng ge dang / sprul dang / glang po dang / ma he dang / dred dang / rta la sogs pas kyang gnod par mi byed do //
translated: One will not be harmed by tigers, thieves, crocodiles, lions, snakes, elephants, buffaloes, bears, horses, and so on.

original: de bzhin du sngags 'dis autpa la brgya rtsa brgyad sbyin sreg byas na gang 'dod pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags 'dis autpa la brgya rtsa brgyad sbyin sreg byas na gang 'dod pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, if one offers into the fire one hundred and eight blue lotuses with this mantra, whoever one desires will be brought under one’s power.

original: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu ki me ba sha ma n'a ya sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu ki me ba sha ma n'a ya sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture amukiṃ me vaśaṃ naya svāhā.

original: de bzhin du sngags 'dis khva'i sgro la lan sum cu rtsa gnyis bsngags la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags 'dis khva'i sgro la lan sum cu rtsa gnyis bsngags la /
translated: Likewise, if one incants a crow’s feather thirty-two times with this mantra,

original: dgra bo'i khang par sbas na /
analyzed: dgra bo'i khang par sbas na /
translated: and buries it in the house of an enemy,

original: zhag bdun gyis skrod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhag bdun gyis skrod par 'gyur ro //
translated: in seven days he will be expelled.

original: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re tsa la pra tsa la sh'i ghram g'a mi ni de ba dattam autstsha ta ya h'um phat ces bya ba ni bskrad pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re tsa la pra tsa la sh'i ghram g'a mi ni de ba dattam autstsha ta ya h'um phat ces bya ba ni bskrad pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture cala pracala śīghraṃ gami ni deva dattaṃ ucchādaya hūṃ phaṭ. This is the expulsion rite.

original: de bzhin du sbyor ba gzhan yang aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu ka aa bh'i bh'a n'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyor ba gzhan yang aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu ka aa bh'i bh'a n'am /
translated: Likewise, another application: Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture amuka abhibhāṇām

original: ku m'a ri ma hya mud b'a he na /
analyzed: ku m'a ri ma hya mud b'a he na /
translated: kumārī mahāmudrāhānena

original: ta sya:pi ta pra yatstsha tu sv'a h'a /
analyzed: ta sya:pi ta pra yatstsha tu sv'a h'a /
translated: tasyaḥ pitra prayacchatu svāhā.

original: myos byed gtum pa'i sa bon dang // de bzhin smyo byed 'bras bu dang // mya ngan med pa'i me tog 'dab //
analyzed: myos byed gtum pa'i sa bon dang // de bzhin smyo byed 'bras bu dang // mya ngan med pa'i me tog 'dab //
translated: and the leaf of the flower of the griefless,

original: stong phrag lnga ni sbyin sreg bya //
analyzed: stong phrag lnga ni sbyin sreg bya //
translated: one should offer five thousand oblations.

original: mar dang sbrang rtsi bu ram gyis //
analyzed: mar dang sbrang rtsi bu ram gyis //
translated: With ghee, honey, and molasses,

original: sbyin sreg bu mo 'grub la bsngags //
analyzed: sbyin sreg bu mo 'grub la bsngags //
translated: oblation is recommended for the accomplishment of a girl.

original: de nas zhag bdun sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: de nas zhag bdun sbyor ba yis //
translated: Then, by the practice for seven days,

original: rang 'dod bu mo thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: rang 'dod bu mo thob par 'gyur //
translated: one will obtain a girl of one's own choice.

original: de nas sbyor ba gzhan la yang //
analyzed: de nas sbyor ba gzhan la yang //
translated: Next, there is another practice:

original: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu k'a bh'i dh'a n'am /
analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu k'a bh'i dh'a n'am /
translated: Om Tare Tuttare Ture, may such-and-such come under my control!

original: sv'a sth'a na ta a'a karsha ya ma m'a na ti ke dza:zhes bya ba'i sngags 'dis rgya shug gi tsher ma stong phrag lnga rang byung gi me tog la bsngags shing sbyin sreg byas na 'dis ni rgyal po'i bu mo yang 'gugs par byed do //
analyzed: sv'a sth'a na ta a'a karsha ya ma m'a na ti ke dza:zhes bya ba'i sngags 'dis rgya shug gi tsher ma stong phrag lnga rang byung gi me tog la bsngags shing sbyin sreg byas na 'dis ni rgyal po'i bu mo yang 'gugs par byed do //
translated: By this mantra, if one offers five thousand oblations of jujube thorns anointed with natural flowers, this will even summon a princess.

original: de nas gzhan yang sbyor ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang sbyor ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: Next, there is another practice:

original: rang byung gi me tog gis bskus pa'i ras la /
analyzed: rang byung gi me tog gis bskus pa'i ras la /
translated: On a cloth anointed with natural flowers,

original: bcom ldan 'das zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhal gcig phyag gnyis ma /
translated: The Blessed One has one face and two arms.

original: lcags kyu dang / autpa la'i zhags pa phyag na bsnams pa bris la /
analyzed: lcags kyu dang / autpa la'i zhags pa phyag na bsnams pa bris la /
translated: She holds a goad and a noose of utpala flowers in her hands.

original: de'i mdun du @51a * //
analyzed: de'i mdun du @51a * //
translated: In front of her,

original: lha rdzas me tog bzang po 'di //
analyzed: lha rdzas me tog bzang po 'di //
translated: with this excellent divine flower,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas mchod pa byas la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas mchod pa byas la /
translated: and so forth, make offerings.

original: bsgom pa dang ldan pas bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa dang ldan pas bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: One who possesses meditation should do the recitation.

original: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu ka ma me pa tsi ham sva pnam ka th'a ya h'um phat /
analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu ka ma me pa tsi ham sva pnam ka th'a ya h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture amukaṃ me vaśaṃ kuru hūṃ phaṭ.

original: stong phrag lnga bzlas pas 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong phrag lnga bzlas pas 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By reciting five thousand times, she will come.

original: zhags pas ske nas bcings te lcags kyus pu ga la rkang pa gnyis nas autpal yis bcings te /
analyzed: zhags pas ske nas bcings te lcags kyus pu ga la rkang pa gnyis nas autpal yis bcings te /
translated: Bound by the noose around the neck, pierced by the goad in the orifice, and bound by the utpala at the two feet,

original: bsgrub bya mdun du bkug ste /
analyzed: bsgrub bya mdun du bkug ste /
translated: the victim is summoned in front.

original: rkang pa'i 'og tu bsams la bran mo'i gzugs kyis longs spyad par bya //
analyzed: rkang pa'i 'og tu bsams la bran mo'i gzugs kyis longs spyad par bya //
translated: Imagining her under one's feet, one should enjoy her in the form of a servant.

original: de nas sbyor ba gzhan yang sgrol ma'i gzungs kyis lan bdun bsngags pa ste /
analyzed: de nas sbyor ba gzhan yang sgrol ma'i gzungs kyis lan bdun bsngags pa ste /
translated: Then, another practice: the dhāraṇī of Tārā, blessed seven times,

original: bdag nyid kyi mig gnyis byugs la rgyal po'i rigs kyi nang du zhugs na /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi mig gnyis byugs la rgyal po'i rigs kyi nang du zhugs na /
translated: Anointing one's own eyes with it, one should enter among the royalty.

original: rgyal po dang bcas pas bla mar byed cing gcig tu dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //🔽de nas gzhan yang sbyor ba ni sgrol ma'i gzungs brgya rtsa brgyad brjod la /
analyzed: rgyal po dang bcas pas bla mar byed cing gcig tu dbang du byed par 'gyur ro // de nas gzhan yang sbyor ba ni sgrol ma'i gzungs brgya rtsa brgyad brjod la /
translated: The king and his court will honor one and be completely subject to one's will.

original: sbrul gyi rgyal po mgo bo gnyis pa'i mgo thal bar bya ste /🔽ba dmar mo'i mar la aargha'i sbra ba la sdong bu byas te ;
analyzed: sbrul gyi rgyal po mgo bo gnyis pa'i mgo thal bar bya ste / ba dmar mo'i mar la aargha'i sbra ba la sdong bu byas te ;
translated: Next, the procedure: Reciting the Tara-dharani one hundred and eight times, one should reduce the head of a two-headed snake to ashes.🔽With the fat of a red cow, one should make a wick for a lamp,

original: me spar la dud pa bsags par bya'o //
analyzed: me spar la dud pa bsags par bya'o //
translated: and light the wick with fire. One should collect the smoke.

original: dud pa de dang rdo rje nyi ma dang / rdo rje chos gnyis dang bsres shing mnyes la rta mchog gis bdug par bya'o //
analyzed: dud pa de dang rdo rje nyi ma dang / rdo rje chos gnyis dang bsres shing mnyes la rta mchog gis bdug par bya'o //
translated: Mixing that smoke with the two, Vajrasurya and Vajradharma, and grinding it, one should fumigate it with the best of horses.

original: de nas thal ba dang lhan cig tu mig la bskus na gang rdo rje mig gis bltas pa de /
analyzed: de nas thal ba dang lhan cig tu mig la bskus na gang rdo rje mig gis bltas pa de /
translated: Then, anointing one's eyes with that ash, whoever is looked at with the Vajra eye

original: padma gar dbang 'dzag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: padma gar dbang 'dzag par 'gyur ro //
translated: will drip with Padmanarteshvara.

original: de ltar ma gyur na bdag nyid sgrol mas bcom ldan 'das nges par bgrongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma gyur na bdag nyid sgrol mas bcom ldan 'das nges par bgrongs pa yin no //
translated: If that does not happen, Tara will certainly kill the Blessed One.

original: de nas sbyor ba gzhan yang lto ba'i srin bu la gzungs kyis lan bdun bsngags pa /
analyzed: de nas sbyor ba gzhan yang lto ba'i srin bu la gzungs kyis lan bdun bsngags pa /
translated: Next, the other procedure: having enchanted seven times with the dhāraṇī the intestinal worms of a corpse,

original: rdo rje chos dang lhan cig tu byas la /
analyzed: rdo rje chos dang lhan cig tu byas la /
translated: make them into a paste with Vajradharma,

original: so rtsi dang sbyar la sbyin no //
analyzed: so rtsi dang sbyar la sbyin no //
translated: and give it to the person to be subjugated.

original: de longs spyod na sbyor ba'i mchog 'dis rang gi chung ma bzhin du gtong bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽de nas sbyor ba gzhan yang 'di yin te /
analyzed: de longs spyod na sbyor ba'i mchog 'dis rang gi chung ma bzhin du gtong bar mi 'gyur ro // de nas sbyor ba gzhan yang 'di yin te /
translated: If he consumes it, by this supreme procedure he will not be able to leave the subjugator’s wife, as if she were his own wife.🔽Next, the other procedure: having taken the tongue of a newborn child, enchant it seven times with Tārā’s dhāraṇī, and make a paste with bhrṅgarāja and guggulu.

original: so ma skyes pa'i bu chung gi lce blangs la sgrol ma'i gzungs kyis lan bdun bsngags la bhring+ga r'a dza dang / gi'u wang dang gcig tu byas te dpral bar thig le byas te gang la bltas pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so ma skyes pa'i bu chung gi lce blangs la sgrol ma'i gzungs kyis lan bdun bsngags la bhring+ga r'a dza dang / gi'u wang dang gcig tu byas te dpral bar thig le byas te gang la bltas pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Make a bindu on the forehead of the person at whom you glare, and he will be subjugated.

original: sbyor ba gzhan zhag chen pos rang gi lus la byugs te bsgom pa dang ldan pas sgrol ma'i gzungs khri tsho gcig bzlas pa bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan zhag chen pos rang gi lus la byugs te bsgom pa dang ldan pas sgrol ma'i gzungs khri tsho gcig bzlas pa bya'o //
translated: The other procedure: having anointed one’s body with human fat, one should recite Tārā’s dhāraṇī one hundred thousand times, endowed with meditation.

original: bzlas pa'i mthar 'bras s'a lu'i zan gyis dril phyis byas la dril phyis de bsdus te gang la byin pa ji srid 'tsho'i bar dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i mthar 'bras s'a lu'i zan gyis dril phyis byas la dril phyis de bsdus te gang la byin pa ji srid 'tsho'i bar dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: At the end of the recitation, roll up the rice gruel with a leaf, and roll up the leaf. Whoever is given this will be under one’s power for as long as one lives.

original: sbyor ba gzhan yang zla ba gzas zin pa'i dus su sgrol @51b ma'i gzungs bzlas shing sngon du bsnyen pa byas na /
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan yang zla ba gzas zin pa'i dus su sgrol @51b ma'i gzungs bzlas shing sngon du bsnyen pa byas na /
translated: Another method: at the time of a lunar eclipse, recite the Tārā dhāraṇī and do the preliminary practice.

original: de las byung ba'i spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug tu dung gi phye ma sbyor bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug tu dung gi phye ma sbyor bar bya'o //
translated: Mix the conch powder that comes from it with the eye of Avalokiteśvara.

original: de gang la byin pa de ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gang la byin pa de ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever is given this will follow for as long as one lives.🔽Another method: enchant the fruit of the madana plant one hundred and eight times with the Tārā dhāraṇī.

original: sbyor ba gzhan yang sgrol ma'i gzungs smyo byed kyi 'bras bu la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bsngags te 'bras bu de dang / rta mgrin dang lhan cig tu gang la byugs pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan yang sgrol ma'i gzungs smyo byed kyi 'bras bu la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bsngags te 'bras bu de dang / rta mgrin dang lhan cig tu gang la byugs pa de dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Anoint with that fruit and Hayagrīva whoever one wants, and they will be enthralled.

original: sbyor ba gzhan ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan ni /
translated: Another method:

original: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu ka sya bandha na muktim ku ru sv'ah'a /
analyzed: aom t'a re tutt'a re tu re aa mu ka sya bandha na muktim ku ru sv'ah'a /
translated: “Oṃ tāre tuttāre ture, please liberate the bonds of such and such.

original: sngags 'dis aarka'i 'dab ma la bsgrub bya'i ming bar du bcug ste bris la /
analyzed: sngags 'dis aarka'i 'dab ma la bsgrub bya'i ming bar du bcug ste bris la /
translated: Having written the name of the person to be effected in the middle of this mantra on an arka leaf,

original: srin bu ka ka ru'i khung bur bcug ste sbas na /
analyzed: srin bu ka ka ru'i khung bur bcug ste sbas na /
translated: put it in the hole of a kakarupa insect and bury it.

original: bcings pa las grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcings pa las grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be freed from bondage.

original: rdo rje sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so //
analyzed: rdo rje sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so //
translated: The Vajra Tara Sadhana is complete.

original: pandi ta don yod rdo rje dang / khams pa lo ts'a ba dge slong ba ris bsgyur cing zhus so//
analyzed: pandi ta don yod rdo rje dang / khams pa lo ts'a ba dge slong ba ris bsgyur cing zhus so//
translated: It was translated, corrected and finalized by the pandita Amoghavajra and the translator-monk Chag Drakpa Gyaltsen.
